intro: Eriosema togense, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular surfaces that give it a velvety appearance, hence its common name. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in sunny conditions. Eriosema togense is also noted for its potential use in traditional medicine.
